heroPanel.title: Californians are connected by their water
content: From mountains to coast and north to south, Californians share water through one of the largest and most complex conveyance systems in the world. Most of California's water falls far from where it's needed. It flows—through rivers, tunnels, and canals—to cities, farms, and ecosystems across the state.
The COEQWAL project helps you understand how California moves water, what alternatives look like, and how we might adapt the system for a changing climate.
